content.body: I didn't realize how closely our API matched [Python's](https://peps.python.org/pep-0567/)
content.formatted_body: I didn't realize how closely our API matched Python's

content.body: Even my suggested constructor params, method names, etc, all somehow the same
Their `set()` and `reset()` API is worse, though.
content.formatted_body: Their set() and reset() API is worse, though.

content.body: I like the idea of calling the instances “context variables” instead of “async contexts”. This seems more intuitive
content.formatted_body: I like the idea of calling the instances “context variables” instead of “async contexts”. This seems more intuitive

content.body: Also I like the name “context” for the AsyncResource/wrap thing
The cross-linguistic comparison is interesting because I think much of the committee thinks we are doing a crazy C# thing when actually everyplace that has async await finds the need for this
Maybe that should make it into our next presentation
content.formatted_body: Maybe that should make it into our next presentation
